chapter.title: FAQ
chapter.para: For more information on JBoss Developer Studio features, refer to the following FAQ to get the answers on the most "popular" questions.

section.title: Installation Issues

para.emphasis: Visual Editor does not start under Linux

section.para: Linux users may need to do the following to get the visual editor to work correctly on their machines.

listitem.para: On Red Hat based Linux distributions install the xpLib.i386 package
Open the JBDS perspective. If you see the Help view open, close it and restart JBDS
If none of these work, do the following:
Post the Eclipse log file (<workspace>\.metadata\.log) on the forums.

para.emphasis: Do I need to have JBoss server installed to run JBoss Developer Studio?

section.para: No. JBoss Developer Studio already comes bundled with JBoss server. We bundle it together so that you don't need to download any additional software and can test your application in a Web browser right away.

If you want to use a different JBoss server installation, after JBoss Developer Studio is installed open Servers View (select Window > Show View > Others > Server > Servers), then right click on this view > New > Server and follow the wizards steps to point to another Jboss server installation.
JBoss Developer Studio works with any servlet container, not just JBoss. For more information on deployment, please see the Deploying Your Application section.

section.title: How to get Code Assist for Seam specific resources in an externally generated project?
section.para: To get Code Assist for Seam specific resources in an externally generated project, you should enable Seam features in Project Preferences. Right click an imported project and navigate Properties > Seam Settings. Check Seam support box to enable all available Seam Settings.

section.title: How to import an example Seam project from jboss-eap directory?
section.para: To import an example Seam project from jboss-eap into your working directory, you should perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Go to New > Other > Java Project from Existing Buildfile
Point to the build.xml of any chosen project by pressing Browse button
Hit Finish to open the project

section.para: As these seam examples are non WTP projects, next you should enable Seam support for them. To do that, right click the project and go to Properties > Seam Settings.
